Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Panitumumab Addition to Hepatic Arterial Infusion and Systemic Chemotherapy in RAS Wild-Type Colorectal Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: Patients with resected colorectal liver metastases (CRLM) and K RAS wild-type were randomised

Participants.evidence: Patients with resected colorectal liver metastases (CRLM) and K RAS wild-type

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive HAI FUDR + SYS FOLFIRI with or without Pmab

Objective.evidence: aimed to evaluate the efficacy of adding panitumumab (Pmab) to an adjuvant regimen

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was stratified by clinical risk score and previous chemotherapy

Number_Randomised.evidence: Seventy-five patients were randomised, with 38 in the Pmab arm and 37 in the control arm

Result_Outcome.evidence: 25 patients (69%; 95% CI, 53 to 82) in the Pmab arm and 18 patients (47%; 95% CI, 32 to 63) in the control arm

Harms.evidence: Rash was more frequent in the Pmab arm, but grade 3/4 elevations in bilirubin or alkaline phosphatase were similar between groups

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered under NCT01312857
